str2: Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Sarah, wife of Abraham. Of Hebrew origin; Sarra, the wife of Abraham.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From hupo and akouo; to hear under, i.e. To listen attentively; by implication, to heed or conform to a command or authority.
Abraham, progenitor of the Hebrew race. Of Hebrew origin; Abraham, the Hebrew patriarch.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Feminine Singular

str2: A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.

word: if you do what is right
parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: To do that which is good. From agathopoios; to be a well-doer.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
Terror, consternation, dismay. From ptoeo; alarm.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.
